name: Roosevelt Lake
summary: Largest lake in central Arizona. Created by Theodore Roosevelt Dam, completed in 1911.
description: Roosevelt Lake is a reservoir formed by the Theodore Roosevelt Dam on the Salt River. Named after President Theodore Roosevelt, it was the world's tallest masonry dam when completed in 1911 and is a National Historic Landmark. The lake can hold up to 1,653,043 acre-feet of water and provides critical water storage for the Phoenix metropolitan area. The reservoir creates a unique ecosystem where desert and aquatic environments meet, supporting diverse wildlife including bald eagles, great blue herons, largemouth bass, and numerous other species. The lake is popular for boating, fishing, and wildlife observation.
safety: Always wear a life jacket when on the water. Be aware of changing water levels. Stay hydrated in the desert heat. Lightning storms can develop quickly - seek shelter immediately if thunder is heard.
fun_fact: The original Roosevelt Dam was the world's highest masonry dam at 280 feet. It was raised by 77 feet in 1996, bringing the total height to 357 feet.
